intro: Vasconcellosia, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Mexican velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The genus includes several species, most of which are native to Central and South America. Vasconcellosia plants are often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of habitats including forests and savannas. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and sometimes used in traditional medicine.
